level.heading: Jurisdiction.
level.text: The offense of identity theft shall be deemed to be committed in the District of Columbia, regardless of whether the offender is physically present in the District of Columbia, if:
The person whose personal identifying information is improperly obtained, created, possessed, or used is a resident of, or located in, the District of Columbia; or
Any part of the offense takes place in the District of Columbia.

level.heading: Effect of Amendments
level.text: D.C. Law 18-88, in par. (1), substituted "resident of, or located in," for "resident of".
